name: dynamic_heavy_path_decomposition
chinese_name: 浅谈一类实现简易的动态树型结构信息维护方法
author: 肖岱恩
complexity: O(log n) amortized (splay-based), O(log n) worst-case (WBLT-based)
summary: The paper discusses two efficient and easy-to-implement methods for maintaining information on dynamically changing tree structures (forests), supporting operations such as linking, cutting, path/connected-component updates, and queries. The first method uses splay trees with auxiliary leafy trees (SLT) to maintain real-path decomposition with amortized O(log n) complexity. The second method replaces splays with weight-balanced leafy trees (WBLT) and employs dynamic absolute heavy-path decomposition to achieve strict O(log n) time per operation. Both approaches leverage potential analysis and structural invariants (like heavy-light decomposition) to ensure efficiency.
